title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: When working in the java editor, reverting the file contents is noticeably slower compared to closing and reopening the file.
OB: Currently, when I try to revert the file contents, it takes a significantly longer time than expected.
EB: This seems odd, as reverting the file contents should not be more time-consuming than simply closing and reopening the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file in the editor. 
2. Modify the contents of the file. 
3. Try to revert the file using the 'Revert' option or command. 
4. Observe that the file does not revert quickly.
